content.body:
TabAtkins: are you around perchance? I wonder what the correct fix is for this error:
```
LINE 146: 'Name' key should contain just the property/descriptor name, or a comma-separated list. Found markup:
  '@media/-webkit-device-pixel-ratio'
```
content.formatted_body:
TabAtkins: are you around perchance? I wonder what the correct fix is for this error:

LINE 146: 'Name' key should contain just the property/descriptor name, or a comma-separated list. Found markup:
  '@media/-webkit-device-pixel-ratio'

content.body: I need this to unblock https://github.com/whatwg/compat/pull/277
You probably want to move the @media part to a For: line. But let me check the PR
(I'm in bed, but have a sec because I'm waiting for my watch to charge)
It's not directly part of the PR and this is something that used to work and does generate a link still according to PR Preview.
I apologize but I'll have to debug in the morning.
All good, have a good night!
So this is what the original WHATWG looks like?
annevk: Filed a PR fixing the issues in the spec.
content.formatted_body: annevk: Filed a PR fixing the issues in the spec.

content.body: The one that your builds were triggering looks to have been caused by me switching inline shorthands to be handled in the parser; the timing change in how the shorthand was handled caused it to get caught by the check (which it should have always done). There's a `Repository` issue that I'm not sure how it built at all; I don't see any metadata setting that. Maybe I'm missing something.
content.formatted_body: The one that your builds were triggering looks to have been caused by me switching inline shorthands to be handled in the parser; the timing change in how the shorthand was handled caused it to get caught by the check (which it should have always done). There's a Repository issue that I'm not sure how it built at all; I don't see any metadata setting that. Maybe I'm missing something.
